pullRequest.body:
Follows up on Yael's comment in #8612 by making `n` (in `x ^ (p ^ n)`) explicit.

---
- [x] depends on: #8612 Lucas' Theorem

CI should fail in places where the theorems are used, but I will fix them using the CI results.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b7073f2ab1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14416/commits/b7073f2ab1822c08d17c871780986bd7a11d7a36)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+--+ add_pow_prime_eq`
`+--+ add_pow_prime_pow_eq`
`+--+ exists_add_pow_prime_eq`
`+--+ exists_add_pow_prime_pow_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Only the final commit (36th) is from this PR, the rest is from #8612.
Why are you making this depend on #8612 and not the other way around?

Because that one is tagged maintainer-merge so I thought I shouldn't touch it. Oh also the actual dependency part is I also refactor `add_pow_eq_add_pow_mod_mul_pow_add_pow_div`, if that's what you're asking
Oh, feel free to keep on touching PRs after they were maintainer merged. We're going to change the workflow soon to make it clearer that `maintainer-merge` is not a once and for all state.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#8612~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Are you planning to return to this PR? If not I can take this over.

I disagree with the need to remove the `include`.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

We don't have a strong policy against `include` (yet?) and I think an `include` directly after the variable command can be fine in certain cases (if it's not omitted later).

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11326055332/job/31494205769)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11326055332/job/31494206354)

Thanks! ðŸš€

maintainer merge

```suggestion
variable [CommSemiring R] {p : â„•} (hp : p.Prime) (x y : R) (n : â„•)
include hp
```
so that `hp` stays before `x y n`
Oh yes, thank you, `include hp` works well. I also changed the section above.
I think even `section`ed or `namespace`d `include`s are advised against, in favor of `include ... in`, but it's possible I'm wrong here. Admittedly the sections are short, so maybe it's fine.

I checked in the reviewer stream on Zulip, and indeed I think we want to only have `include ... in`, so please either change it to that, or else back to explicitly writing the hypothesis in each statement.
I don't think there is such a consensus, though?
IMO it's a bad idea, duplicating the same hypothesis is just being annoying for no reason, isn't that the point of section variables?
The reason using `include` like this is advised against is that it's really easy to accidentally include a hypothesis in a theorem that doesn't need it.
Yes but all theorems here are about that hypothesis! And there is a linter against unused hypotheses anyway
ditto

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(CharP): make variables explicit + refactor
